actualResults.title: No Brute Force Protection on Login Endpoint
actualResults.assessment: Valid security discovery - The application lacks rate limiting, account lockout, or other brute force protection mechanisms on the login endpoint, allowing unlimited sequential login attempts without throttling or delays.

actualResults.title: Email Validation Bypass - Accepts Emails with Leading/Trailing Spaces
actualResults.assessment: Valid security discovery - Input validation weakness where the email field accepts and processes leading/trailing whitespace without normalization.

actualResults.title: DEBUG Mode Enabled - Information Disclosure
actualResults.assessment: Valid security discovery - DEBUG=True exposes sensitive information through verbose error pages.

actualResults.title: Email Validation Bypass - Accepts Excessively Long Emails
actualResults.assessment: Valid security discovery - Server-side validation does not enforce the HTML maxlength='320' limit.

actualResults.title: Stored XSS in Step 3 via Name Parameter Injection
actualResults.assessment: Valid security discovery - User-supplied name from Step 1 is reflected directly into JavaScript alert() statement without proper escaping.

actualResults.title: Insufficient Email Format Validation - Accepts Template Injection Payloads
actualResults.assessment: Valid security discovery - Email validation accepts invalid email formats containing template injection syntax.

actualResults.title: Weak Password Validation - Client-Side Only with Insufficient Minimum Length
actualResults.assessment: Valid security discovery - Password validation enforced only via HTML5 minlength attribute on client-side.

actualResults.title: Workflow Manipulation - State Reversion via Step Revisit
actualResults.assessment: Valid security discovery - Multi-step registration workflow fails to enforce sequential completion.

actualResults.title: Missing Duplicate Email Validation - Multiple Registrations with Same Email
actualResults.assessment: Valid security discovery - Email uniqueness constraint not enforced.

actualResults.title: Broken Authentication Mechanism on /accounts/login/ Endpoint
actualResults.assessment: Valid security discovery - Authentication system is completely non-functional.

actualResults.title: Potential IDOR Vulnerability in /accounts/preferences/ - User ID Parameter Accepted
actualResults.assessment: Valid security discovery - Endpoint accepts user_id parameters without authorization validation.

actualResults.title: Session Hijacking - Insufficient Session Validation
actualResults.assessment: Valid security discovery - Session validation fails to verify session ownership.

actualResults.title: Missing CSRF Protection on Logout Endpoint - GET Request Vulnerability
actualResults.assessment: Valid security discovery - Logout endpoint accepts HTTP GET requests without CSRF token validation.

actualResults.title: Excessive CSRF Token Expiration - 1 Year Validity
actualResults.assessment: Valid security discovery - CSRF tokens configured with excessive expiration.

actualResults.title: Missing HttpOnly Flag on CSRF Token Cookie
actualResults.assessment: Valid security discovery - CSRF token cookie lacks HttpOnly flag.

actualResults.title: Missing Secure Flag on CSRF Token Cookie
actualResults.assessment: Valid security discovery - CSRF token cookie lacks Secure flag.

matched.actualTitle: Server-Side Template Injection (SSTI) in Registration Name Field - Environment Variable Disclosure
matched.matchReason: Both findings describe the same vulnerability: unsanitized user input from the registration name field is directly inserted into a Jinja2 template string without proper escaping or sandboxing. The actual finding provides more detailed evidence showing {{request.environ}} payload execution and environment variable disclosure (HOSTNAME, HOME, PATH, DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE, etc.), which demonstrates the SSTI vulnerability described in the expected finding.
